content.description: Begin on the east side of the Wigwam Boulder with a stand start at the arete. Left hand on the waist high grove and right on the arete. Make a balancy move to a left hand crimp. From here bump to the disk crimp and then climb up and right to the crack. Top out.
content.location: This route is located on the Wigwam boulder, towards the south side of the boulder field.

content.description: Start on high bad right foot with good left crimp and sloppy right pinch in the middle of the face. make a hard and low percentage move to a right facing sloppy dish and then move straight up through crimp rails to the top.
content.protection: pad and spotter or spotters are a must. the boulder sits on another boulder that quickly drops off after a few feet. small sloppy landing
content.location: back right side of the cluster of boulders, see pictures

content.description: Begin 8’ left of Tomahawk with matched hands in the horizontal crack. Get some high feet under you and build up some power as you make a right handed dino for the dish crimp. Move your feet to the crack and then proceed straight up through the dish. Continue up with slabby feet and delicate moves to top out.
content.location: Located on the Wigwam Boulder, 8 feet left of Tomahawk.

content.description: Begin with a sit start at the arete, located on the uphill side of the Wigwam boulder. Start with your left hand on a seam and your right on a high crimp. Straddle the arete and bump your left hand up the seam. Make a big move to a V shaped notch on the lip and then a balancy move to a jug straight up. Top out.
content.location: This route is located on the Wigwam boulder, which is in the south side of the boulder field. Locate the arete on the uphill side.

content.description: Starts compression on the boulder with good right hand crimp. work to the right and then back to compression using heal hooks and techy high feet.
content.location: Just left of Slippery when wet, at the back right of the boulders.

content.description: Begin with a sit start under Bison Rampage with right hand on the arete and left on a small crimp. Make a right handed bump up the arete and adjust feet. Make a move to the right tending rail and proceed up Bison Rampage.
content.location: Located on the Wigwam Boulder, at the base of "Bison Rampage."

content.description: Locate the arete on the downhill side of the Wigwam boulder. Begin with a stand start under the horizontal crack, with one hand on the arete and the other on the right tending rail.  Get your feet under you and make a long reach up to the crack system.  Now traverse right until the cracks end. Make a reach around the edge to a jug. Top out.
content.location: This problem is located on the down hill side of the Wigwam boulder.

content.description: Egg shaped rock similar too Harken hill A few tall lines but blank faces. We developed the obvious lines and there seems to be potential for more but not a ton. mostly moderate to easy potential.
